channel.title: linux on Dhananjay's Blog
channel.description: Recent content in linux on Dhananjay's Blog

item.title: ext Linux Filesystem
item.description: This post covers all versions of ext filesystem. ext Created to overcome limitations of MINIX filesystem. First filesystem specificaly desined for Linux kernel. Restricted filename lengths to 255 characters and supported partitions up to 2GB. Major flaw - Allowed only one timestamp per file. ext2 Released less than year afer introduction of ext. Supported the maximum file size of 2TiB and filename can be 255 bytes long. Does not support journaling.

item.title: Compiling tbronzwaer/raptor
item.description: Introduction This post documents steps required to compile tbronzwaer/raptor and use plotter.py Dependencies Ubuntu 18.04 Install Ubuntu 18.04 as a VM. (https://releases.ubuntu.com/18.04/) Build Dependencies sudo apt install gcc build-essential gfortran libpng-dev GNU Scientific computing Library (GSL) GSL needs to be compiled from source. cd ~ git clone https://github.com/ampl/gsl.git cd gsl mkdir build && cd build cmake .. -G"Unix Makefiles" -DNO_AMPL_BINDINGS=1 make sudo make install CBLAS library (Basic Linear Algebra Subprograms) Build blas_LINUX.
